column1: Garching bei München or Garching is a town in Bavaria
column3: near Munich.  It is the home of several research institutes and university departments. It became a city on 14 September 1990.

column2: near the river Isar and the Bundesautobahn 9.

column1: Garching has a number of scientific research institutes and scientific experiment facilities located in the city
column2: including a linear accelerator and a research nuclear reactor. The nuclear research reactor
column3: nicknamed Atomei (atomic egg) appears in the city's coat of arms
column4: and started the process leading to an accumulation of research institutes. A number of roads and places in the city are named after scientists
column5: mathematicians and technical innovators such as Carl von Linde

column1: Hochschul- und Forschungszentrum (University and Research Centre) - formerly known as Forschungsinstitute (Research Institutes)
The Munich U-Bahn line U6 connects the city with the stations Garching-Hochbrück
Several research and scientific educational institutions are based in Garching
Departments of the Technical University of Munich (TUM)
semiconductor physics and engineering (Walter Schottky Institute)
Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics (MPE)
Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics (IPP)
Max Planck Institute for Quantum Optics (MPQ)
Max Planck Computing and Data Facility (MPCDF)
Part of the physics department of the Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität
Headquarters of the European Southern Observatory (ESO)
ESO Supernova Planetarium & Visitor Centre at ESO Headquarters
Federal Research Institute for Food Chemistry (Deutsche Forschungsanstalt für Lebensmittelchemie; DFA)
Walther Meißner Institute (WMI) of the BAdW (low-temperature physics)
Bavarian Center of Applied Energy Research (ZAE)
Leibniz-Rechenzentrum [3] of the BAdW (central computing facilities for the Munich universities and other research institutes)
BMW M GmbH - high-performance/motorsport vehicle research and development
Garching is part of the Nordallianz
column2: a group of 8 towns situated between the city of Munich and Munich Airport.

column1: Garching bei München is twinned with:
The town's football club VfR Garching
column3: experienced its greatest success in 2014 when it won promotion to the Regionalliga Bayern for the first time.
